Adam Smith is known as the “Father of Capitalism” on the other hand his peer, Karl Marx, is known as the “Father of Communism.” The thoughts of these two men differentiate as a general rule; however there is some similitude in the thinking behind a large number of their thoughts. The primary contrasts incorporate their thoughts in regards to the division of work and how merchandise and enterprises ought to be esteemed and evaluated by makers while the fundamental similitude between the two includes their perspectives on the advantages of rivalry between the makers of products and ventures.

Smith contended that the division of work would be amazing regardless of whether all people were indistinguishable as a result of the possibility that profitable limits are found out (Munger 2018). Karl Marx saw this thought as what wasn't right with society. He thought it was out of line to constrain men to contend and saw the division of work as the reason for a social pecking order. He contended this upset society and made social issues through the opposition. He trusted that customers would possibly buy a decent or benefit when the cost was at a point in which they trusted they would profit by. In view of this, Marx contended that charging customers anything more noteworthy than the estimation of the work put into the item by the specialists was misuse of the laborers. Marx trusts that when specialists are being paid at a rate that is not as much as what the great they are delivering is being sold for, that it makes surplus esteem. This surplus esteem is the thing that makes the benefits that go into the pockets of the organization proprietors.

Adam and Marx both trusted that contender among maker was advantageous for society overall. Smith trusted that competition between producer was gainful on the grounds that it give the purchaser a decision about where they needed to buy goodness from, in this manner keeping maker legitimate and reasonable towards shopper. As per Marx, 'the sole safeguard against the entrepreneurs is contender , which as per the grounds of political economy acts valuably by both raising compensation and bringing down the fiscal estimation of good to the vantage of the expending open,' (Marx 2018). Despite the fact that Marx saw the advantages of rivalry among maker, he likewise observed the negatives of the opposition. Marx trusted that the opposition would inevitably transmutation to the other side and accordingly led to an imposing business model as one maker overwhelmed the rest.

Two major differences in the ideas of Smith and Karl are based around the division of labor and how to value goods and services. The similitude discussed was their views on the benefits of competition between producers. Although most of the ideas and theories of Adam and Karl differ, there are parallel to be found.
